title: A Major Disappointment with Champion Mastery
body:
One major disappointment i have with it is that it is so based on winning instead of doing well with that champ, "if you wanna stress about winning play ranked, if you wanna play to do well with a champ, play for champion mastery" thats how i thought it was gunna be, but instead its based almost 100% on winning, even if you do crap with a champ and Win you get 4x/5x the points of a Loss where you did really well, how is that mastering a champion? thats just getting carried or not. 

for example (picture included) i played with Yas and got what i think is a good score, it marked me on S ranking on the thing which is the highest, but we lost in the end because the enemy team played really well. and i got a measly 62 points on the thing (on the first level too) 
and then played a game with the new ashe, it was a 3v5 for the whole game (we were the 3) except laning phase where it was 4v5 and it got to 53 min before we lost, and i got a good score, so i thought that was pretty good going. and still only got 127 or something like that, and then played a shaco game got a score like 0/2/6 or something like that and we won and the points bar went halfway round the world to 900 something points....
how is this mastering a champion?? 

(excuse the odd Yas build, i had the wrong runes and needed 10% crit)

replies.body:
I lost a game with a fed Champ and got really low points. Won a game with a really shit K;D R and levelled up faster with said champ.

'nuff said.

Champion mastery is for those that can win games, if you can't win with your champion that you are mastering then why on earth do you think you deserve to rank up with that champion? It works both ways, win your games and play well while winning them, the system isn't perfect and it never will be but it does its job.

Wouldnt that be 'game mastery'? you are doing well at the game e.g. winning a lot. as opposed to 'Champion mastery' e.g. doing well with that champion a lot. 
if you go as draven and get 0/50/0 but still win every game, i wouldnt say you had mastered that champ.
No it wouldn't, winning games has everything to do with how good you are with the champ, you're way over exaggerating with that Draven going 0/50/0 and winning every game thing.

you forget it is a team game.
it is possible to play badly with a champ e.g. make bad decisions, be generally unlucky, get caught out. and still win because either your team did well or the enemy team did worse.
and it is also possible to play really really well. make awesome decisions, have awesome map awareness and still lose because you team fed or the enemy team played even better. 

i could be a god with soraka or someone like that, but if the enemy team has a kat and a talon who is also playing well
they are gunna win, that doesnt mean that i played badly with soraka it means that their champs were more influential or countered mine.

and yea i was over exaggerating it because thats how you analyse weather what you are saying is true or not, if you take it to the extremes and it still matches what you say then great you are right. and if it doesn't then you arent 100% correct.

Don't give me that team game crap, if you don't win games then you are not very good with the champion and so you should get less points, end of story.

No that is not how you analyse, what you said was completely unrealistic therfor it has no place in this discussion, it is just you coming up with silly points that does nothing to defend your argument.

"dont give me that team game crap" why not? it requires team of 5 people to play it... 
that pretty much qualifies it as a team game...

i still have points to give so it isn't quite the end of story is it?
i dont think you understand, it is possible to win a game even if you play badly with a champ.
i could afk before the game begins and still win because my team was really good, 
have i then mastered that champ because i won even though i didnt even play?

i could play really really well (enough to win any other game) but if in that game the enemy plays even better, then they win 
its not like just because they played better that i played badly. 
look at the LCS teams, in the final game the two best teams play and even though both teams play better than anyone else in the world, one will still lose, that doesnt mean that team played badly it just means the other team played slightly better. 

it is unrealistic because if you don't test the extremes of a point then it isn't fully understood
if what you say is not true for the extremes of the point you make then it isn't 100% correct. 
when they test medicine in a lab, they don't do 1 human test and say "oh yep it works go sell it" 
they test all the extremes, young childeren, elderly people, healthy people, women, men.
they test all the extremes because if the medicine harms one particular demographic then it isn't 100% effective as a solution. its the same here, your point might be acceptable in some parts of the spectrum but it doesnt work at the extremes, even though the example i gave wasn't realistic , you cant deny that it is still possible, and therefore must be considered.
otherwise your point isn't thought through at all.

You still don't get it despite it being so obvious, you know its not only wins that give you points right? How you perform with said champion is also a factor, but to say wins shouldn't determine how good you are with the champion is just plain stupid and makes you look dumb.

It is end of story, wins determine how good you are and if you think otherwise you're just being stupid.

Ignoring 9/10ths of my argument shows your argument isn't well founded, if your argument is correct you should be able to easily negate all the points i have put forward, instead of saying the same things over and over again ignoring all the points i have made to disprove it.

i know its not just the wins that count, but the win or loss factor counts far more than any other. 
have you never done well with a champ and lost? or done badly with a champ and won? ever? i know i have!
i dont want to be rewarded for playing badly and being carried to victory by someone else because that means i haven't mastered the champion it just means i happened to play that champion when i had a good team.

Wins determine how good you are at the GAME, 
K/D/A CS and Objective control in lane determine how well you perform with a particular CHAMP

Your points are dumb and you're just showing you have no idea how these things work, you are in fact ignoring what i'm saying, i have told you so clearly yet you still come up with more stupid things to say.

If you have decent k/d/a and CS plus ward count and you win then yes you did well despite your team carrying you, as long as you don't do that badly like going 0/5/0, not cs'ing or warding then you should get decent points, you can play badly but well enough to keep in it, it shows you're competent enough to put up a fight even when you do badly.

No, each champion is apart of this game and so doing well with the champion determines how much you win which means wins determine how good you are not only with your champion but at the game, i feel like you're some low elo player that doesn't know what he's talking about and insists AP Darius is a good build, think before you come up with these silly comments.

You've ignored everything he's said and basically said, 'winning means you're good, losing means you're shit'. Uhhh no. That is the equivalent (100%) to saying being rich in life means it was a good life, and being poor means you've had a terrible life. Get over yourself.

I have ignored nothing, i read everything he had to say but i did not want to respond to it all because its like a fight between Atheists and Christians, one is right and the other is wrong but the one who is wrong refuses to grow up and instead makes up dumb points to defend themselves which only makes them look like further idiots, you can do the math on which is wrong here i ain't going into detail.

I've been around gaming all my life, i have played league for many years and i know how competetive games work, winning doesn't mean you're good, you could've started league in bronze V and climbed to bronze 1 in a week, that doesn't mean you're good because you're still bronze, thought this would be common sense but i guess to people like you it isn't, its all about how far you have gone while winning that determines how good you are.

Its not simply winning that makes you good its how much you win that determines if you are good and also how you went about winning, same goes for losing, it is a fact that losing more than winning means you are below the average and in many cases bad (Bronze).

Sorry but your "equivalent" is incredibly stupid and does not apply to this in any way, money does't equal happiness and never has, take Robin Williams, he was wealthy and loved by everyone, many people grew up watching him including myself, yet he suffered depression and hanged himself.

Get over myself? How about you wake up and accept the facts, the system is exactly how i'm saying it is and its like that for a very good reason, clearly Riot is on my side, the community also has no problem with this system except for a small amount and usually those are the people that are just mad and want to bitch and moan when things don't go their way.

You can go 0/7 and still get 1.2k points if you win.
You can be 30/0 and get 100 points if you lose.

The system is dodgy and doesn't reward you for being good at the champion, all you have to do is win.
exactly, its not "this is how good i am at ..." its "look how many games I've happened to win with ..."
Or lose with, even bad players can still reach lvl 5 if they play enough.
exactly, so how is that 'mastering' a champion?

Its a protoype, dont forget that.
I think they should fall off from there lvl 4-5 if they receive the "Unskilled" report.

Yes but still the underlying concept is that its about playing well with a champion, not about winning, even for a prototype that concept should be the base of the whole thing. And I see where you're coming from, but everyone has bad days or gets matched with toxic players who just report people because they lost and are mad, so that might be a bit harsh.

All we can really do is just play this out.
Eventually riot gonna think up of something that will 'Balance' this.
But I still think that if you get reported for "Unskilled" multiple times as X-Y champ, much like the honor system if its frequent enough you should drop to lvl2-3.
one does not simply expect to live a normal life amongst humans once showing they built a triforce on yasuo. git the fuck out ma planet
If you play well you should win, in most cases. S is the second best mark. 20/11/4 and a loss just isn't good enough to get the highest mark, it's that simple.
You also get a lot more points in ranked than in norms I think. CS also plays a big part in how many points you earn.
